thread.title: Trump blasts Obama for emptying Gitmo | New York Post
thread.title_full: Trump blasts Obama for emptying Gitmo | New York Post

author: Daniel Halper
title: Trump blasts Obama for emptying Gitmo | New York Post
text:
President Trump took aim on Tuesday at his predecessor for emptying the detention center at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba — allowing terrorists to return to war.
“122 vicious prisoners, released by the Obama Administration from Gitmo, have returned to the battlefield. Just another terrible decision!” Trump said in a morning tweet. 
It appears to reference reports from Monday that a former Guantanamo Bay detainee was killed on March 2 by a US airstrike authorized by Trump at an al-Qaeda outpost in Yemen.
The Pentagon confirmed the death of Yasir al-Silmi who was released in 2009 by former President Obama.
In Obama’s first campaign for the White House, he pledged to shut down the terror detention center immediately after coming into office. But instead of it closing, Obama released many of the detainees over the next 8 years.
Trump, by contrast, pledged to fill Gitmo back up. 
“This morning, I watched President Obama talking about Gitmo, right, Guantanamo Bay, which by the way, which by the way, we are keeping open. Which we are keeping open … and we’re gonna load it up with some bad dudes, believe me, we’re gonna load it up,” he said last February.
It’s unclear what prompted Trump’s outburst Tuesday.
